timeline.message:
Add contingency dsl ext

Signed-off-by: Paul Bui-Quang <paul.buiquang@rte-france.com>

Use directly contingency base spec

Signed-off-by: Paul Bui-Quang <paul.buiquang@rte-france.com>

Use directly contingency base spec

Signed-off-by: Paul Bui-Quang <paul.buiquang@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: Is it really necessary to make this interface generic? I think if we make it generic, this interface is misplaced and should be moved into powsybl-dsl module.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText:
at first i thought this would be usefull for other extendable objects, and i tried to put it in common or dsl, then i stepped back.
I will put it in the dsl package though unused really since I extend it with specific ContingencyDslExtension now. Should we let it for future use or not ?
replies.author: pl-buiquang

timeline.bodyText:
It just a detail, but:

could you indent the code propertly
could you add another contingency and check below that there is no extension for the second contingency
timeline.author: mathbagu
mathbagu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,45 @@

+package com.powsybl.contingency.dsl;
+
+import com.powsybl.commons.extensions.Extension;
+import com.powsybl.contingency.Contingency;
+
+/**
+ * @author Paul Bui-Quang <paul.buiquang at rte-france.com>
+ */
+public class ProbabilityContingencyExtension implements Extension<Contingency> {
+    private Contingency contingency;
+
+    private Double probabilityBase = 1.0;

replies.bodyText: i want it to be nullable, anyway, this is a test and not a real extension
replies.author: pl-buiquang

replies.bodyText:
You have to choose: if it's nullable, you have to be consistent with the getter. If not, you have to change the variable type.
Even we are in unit test, it's not a good reason to not pay attention the way we are coding.
replies.author: mathbagu

timeline.author: mathbagu
